knowledge_zone.heading: Symbolism: Deeper meaning through symbolic objects/actions

sections.content: Symbolism is used throughout the text to deeper meaning through symbolic objects/actions.

examples.effect: The garden door symbolizes entry into an enchanted but temporary world, reinforcing the elegiac pattern of beauty discovered and lost

examples.quote: the archaic weapons of the tribe and sound the drums
examples.scene: Extended metaphor of Sebastian as threatened Polynesian
examples.effect: Sebastian's drinking becomes symbol of civilization's corruption of the noble savage, elevating personal tragedy to universal commentary on cultural destruction

examples.quote: little pool of ice-water which now surrounded the swan
examples.scene: Opening cocktail party where guests put out cigarettes in melted ice around decorative swan
examples.effect: The swan surrounded by ash-contaminated water symbolizes corrupted beauty and elegiac loss, establishing the retrospective narrator's meditation on the decay of elegance

pedagogy_zone.heading: From Device Spotting to Analysis
pedagogy_zone.intro_text: Most students can identify a device. Strong analysis shows what it DOES. Don't just label it—explain its function in creating meaning.

content.question: Ask yourself: Why does the author use Symbolism HERE? What meaning does it create in this specific moment?
content.framework: Use TVODE: Technique → Verb → Observation → Device effect → Evaluation

pedagogy_zone.essay_application: In your essays, always connect device to meaning. Show HOW the technique creates the effect, don't just identify that it's there.
